description.en: Basic knowledges about cellular and molecular aspects of immune system are given. Also we explain possibilities for evaluation of immune system function and treatment in clinical settings.
description.et: Aine annab baasteadmised immunsüsteemi funktsioneerimise rakulistest ja molekulaarsetest alustest ning immuunsüsteemi seisundi hindamise ja mõjustamise põhilistest kliinilistest võimalustest.

objectives.en: To get basic knowledges for the further studies in clinical medicine.

learning_outcomes.en: At the end of the course, within the syllabus, a student:
learning_outcomes.et: Õppeaine läbimise järgselt, vastavalt programmile, üliõpilane:

learning_outcomes.en: 1. is acquainted with the basic but up-to-date knowledge about the immune system;
learning_outcomes.et: 1. on omandanud nüüdisaegsel tasemel baasteadmised immuunsüsteemi funktsioneerimisest;

learning_outcomes.en: 2. knows and understands the cellular and molecular mechanisms of the immune system;
learning_outcomes.et: 2. tunneb ja mõistab immuunsüsteemi funktsioneerimise rakulisi ja molekulaarseid aluseid;

learning_outcomes.en: 3. knows the general properties of the diseases and pathological conditions which are immune system related, is able to understand the corresponding immune processes in the human organism, is capable to give examples of most common disorders in immune system;
learning_outcomes.et: 3. teab üldjoontes immuunsüsteemi funktsiooni muutusega seotud sagedamini esinevaid haigusi ja seisundeid, suudab aru saada immuunsüsteemiga seotud protsessidest inimorganismis, oskab tuua olulisemate seisundite kohta näiteid;

learning_outcomes.en: 4. knows how to evaluate the status of the immune system and corresponding options for immune modulation, knows immunological methods and their use in diagnosis;
learning_outcomes.et: 4. teab immuunsüsteemi seisundi hindamise ja mõjutamise võimalusi, immunoloogilisi meetodeid ja nende kasutamist diagnostikas;

learning_outcomes.en: 5. is able to navigate in the modern medical literature on the field of immunology, is able to find specialized scientific articles and to complement its own knowledge about the immunology
learning_outcomes.et: 5. oskab orienteeruda kaasaegses meditsiinilise immunoloogia alases erialakirjanduses, oskab üles leida erialaartiklid ja oma teadmisi iseseisvalt täiendada

independent_work.et:
i) A quiz in Moodle must be passed after each week of thematic seminars.
ii) One short (5-10 min) individual presentation in seminar class must be presented. The timetable and presentation topics are scheduled during the first class/seminar.
iii) One team work presentation, by 3-4 students, 20 - 30 min, must presented in the corresponding seminar (at the end of course).

description.et:
Topics - basic immunology and immunological methods. Differentiated assessment (grading). The test result (results) will count upon into the final assessment (exam) with 25% impact.
First lecture test is about the basic immunology aspects (The Immunology program's first part: Basic Immunology). Most of these topics are covered in first three lectures and four seminars. Use also Abbas' Basic Immunology textbook chapters 1 to 8. All rounds of the 1st test (including negative grades and unexcused missings) are taken into account in the examination. 1st test grade participates with 25% impact to final exam grade. The test can be performed maximum three times.
Max score is 30 points.
Grade A - 28-30 p; B - 25-27 p; C - 22-24 p; D - 19-21 p; E - 16-18 p; F - 15 or less points.

Topic -  clinical immunology. Non-differentiated assessment. The result will not contribute to final (exam) grade.
Quiz about basic aspects of clinical immunology. 75% points out of 100% is sufficient to pass.

Written exam, essays must be written to answer 3 (up to 5) questions. Exam time is 120 minutes.

A -The answer exhibits that the student knows excellently (within the extent of course program) the principles of the immunology, the molecular and cellular basis of immune system function, how the immune system is related to the diseases and pathological conditions. Likewise, s/he knows how to evaluate the immune status, knows the principles of immunological diagnostic tests, possibilities to influence on immune system function. The answer shows and reflects clearly student's deep expertise in the field as the systematic understanding of the topic, the ability to associate logically different knowledge. Orthography and semantics of answers is clear and unambiguous. The answer is focused on the subject and do not include indefinite and vague statements.
B -The answer exhibits that the student knows very well (within the extent of course program) the principles of the immunology, the molecular and cellular basis of immune system function, how the immune system is related to the diseases and pathological conditions. S/he knows how to evaluate the immune status, knows the principles of immunological diagnostic tests, possibilities to influence on immune system function.  The answer shows and reflects the student's very good understanding about the study topics.
C- The answer exhibits that the student well understands (within the extent course program) the principles of the immunology, the molecular and cellular basis of immune system function, how the immune system determines the development of diseases and pathological conditions. S/he knows how to evaluate the immune status, knows the principles of immunological diagnostic tests, possibilities to influence on immune system function, the immunological methods and the principles of diagnostic tests. The answer shows and reflects the student's good overall understanding of the subject, of its main and essential aspects.
D - The answer exhibits that the student knows (within the extent of course program) the main principles of the immunology, the molecular and cellular basis of immune system function, how the immune system determines the development of diseases and pathological conditions, how to evaluate the immune status, the possibilities to influence immune system function. S/he knows the principles of general immunological diagnostic tests and general principles how to influence on immune system function. The answer shows and reflects the student's understanding of the basic and essential aspects of the discipline. There can be some few lightweight mistakes.
E - The answer exhibits that the student has general knowledge (within the extent of course program) about the basic principles of the immunology, the molecular and cellular basis of immune system function, the immune system related diseases and pathological conditions. S/he knows the general principles how to evaluate the immune status, to influence immune system function, to perform immunologic diagnostic tests.  There are several mistakes or misunderstandings in the least aspects. However, the answer is not entirely incorrect.

grade_preconditions.et:
The 1st and 2nd lecture test must be completed.
All seminars must be attended.
All Moodle quizzes must be passed.

grade_evaluation.et: The final grading are done by written exam, essay-type answers to 3 (up to 5) questions (plus the result(s) of the 1st test).

debt_elimination.et: In absence from the seminar, there will be discussion with teacher about the topics and key issues of the materials of this seminar and answering questions.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

description.et: Introduction. (R.Uibo, K.Reimand)
Innate immunity. (R.Uibo)
Immune system central molecules: TLR, MHC, T/B cell receptors. Antibodies. Cytokines (K.Reimand)
Aquired immune response. (R.Uibo)
Immunoassays for testing antigens and antibodies. (K.Reimand)
Immune system under different physiological conditions. (A.Tagoma)
Assays for cell-mediated immunity. (A.Aints)
Hypersensitivity and tissue damage mechanisms I-IV. Allergy. (K.Reimand)
Mid-term summary seminar on the basic aspects of immunology. (K.Reimand)
HLA, other immunogenetic factors and diseases. HLA and transplantation. (K.Reimand)
1.Knowledge Test - EXAM I part
Autoimmunity. (R.Uibo)
Immunotechnology. (A.Aints)
Immunodeficiencies. (K.Reimand)
Allergy diagnosis, tests and assays. (M.Tulk)
Immunity to infections. (A.Tagoma, T.Vorobjova)
Laboratory diagnosis of organ-specific autoimmune diseases. (K.Reimand)
Transplantation immunology. (K.Reimand)
Laboratory diagnosis of systemic autoimmune diseases. (K.Metsküla)
Immunology of tumors. (A.Aints)
Immunology of viral and fungal  infections. (A.Tagoma)
2.Knowledge Test
Modulation of immune system function. (K.Reimand)
Immunology of bacterial infections. (T.Vorobjova)
Modulating the functions of the immune system. Biological drugs. Vaccines. (K.Reimand)
Pre-exam consultation. (R.Uibo, K.Reimand)
Principles and practice of immune status evaluation. (K.Reimand)
Student presentations. Discussion seminar on a published scientific paper. (Different supervisors)
